comments.body:
What is the purpose of this refactoring?
Is this type used elsewhere other than this specific test?
Is `returnMachineInfo()` used elsewhere?

If not, I think it is better to leave these definitions scoped inside of the test itself, rather than create a new type /function that clutters the namespace with something that is not reusable.
Yes, `returnMachineInfo()` is used for both `TestGetTopologyHints()` and `TestGetPodTopologyHints()`. Because of that it is exported in separate function. I will leave it for now as it is.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +139,143 @@		},
		{
			name:          "Request 2 CPUs, 1 available on NUMA 0, 1 available on NUMA 1",
			pod:           *testPod1,
			container:     *testContainer1,
